SAFE-101: Intro to Safety

Course Description

This course provides fundamental knowledge of workplace safety procedures, hazard identification, and emergency response protocols.

Learning Objectives

  • Identify common workplace hazards
  • Understand OSHA regulations
  • Demonstrate proper PPE usage
  • Execute emergency response procedures

Required Materials

  • Safety Equipment Manual (provided)
  • OSHA Quick Card
  • Safety goggles and gloves

Grading

  • Quizzes: 40%
  • Essays: 30%
  • Final Exam: 30%

pages.name: Hazard Types Overview
pages.content:
Types of Workplace Hazards

Physical Hazards

Noise, temperature extremes, radiation, vibration

Chemical Hazards

Toxic substances, corrosives, flammables

Biological Hazards

Bacteria, viruses, blood-borne pathogens

Ergonomic Hazards

Repetitive motion, poor posture, heavy lifting

Psychosocial Hazards

Stress, violence, harassment

pages.name: Emergency Procedures
pages.content:
Emergency Response Guide

Fire Emergency

  1. Activate nearest fire alarm
  2. Evacuate using nearest exit
  3. Assemble at designated meeting point
  4. Report to safety officer

Medical Emergency

  1. Call emergency services (ext. 5555)
  2. Provide first aid if trained
  3. Do not move injured person unless necessary
  4. Complete incident report

Chemical Spill

  1. Evacuate area immediately
  2. Alert nearby personnel
  3. Contact hazmat team
  4. Do not attempt cleanup unless trained

CS-401: Computer Science Fundamentals

Course Description

An introduction to computer science through programming in Python. Topics include variables, control structures, functions, recursion, object-oriented programming, and fundamental data structures.

Learning Outcomes

  • Write well-structured Python programs
  • Understand algorithmic thinking
  • Implement basic data structures
  • Apply object-oriented design principles
  • Debug and test code effectively

Grading

ComponentWeight
Programming Assignments40%
Midterm Exam25%
Final Project30%
Participation5%

pages.name: Python Style Guide
pages.content:
Python Coding Standards

PEP 8 Guidelines

  • Use 4 spaces for indentation (not tabs)
  • Limit lines to 79 characters
  • Use snake_case for function and variable names
  • Use PascalCase for class names
  • Add docstrings to all functions and classes

Example

def calculate_average(numbers):
    """Calculate the average of a list of numbers.
    
    Args:
        numbers (list): List of numeric values
    
    Returns:
        float: The average value
    """
    return sum(numbers) / len(numbers)

pages.name: Debugging Tips
pages.content:
Common Debugging Strategies

Read the Error Message

Python error messages tell you exactly what went wrong and on which line. Read them carefully!

Use Print Statements

Add print() statements to see variable values at different points in your code.

Check Your Indentation

Python is sensitive to indentation. Make sure all blocks are properly indented.

Test with Simple Inputs

Try your function with simple test cases before complex ones.

Use the Python Debugger

Learn to use pdb or your IDE's debugger to step through code line by line.

DH-501: Digital Health UX Design

Course Overview

This advanced course explores user experience design principles specifically for digital health applications. Students will learn to design accessible, compliant, and user-centered healthcare interfaces.

Key Topics

  • Healthcare user research methodologies
  • HIPAA compliance in UX design
  • Accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 AA)
  • Design for diverse patient populations
  • Prototyping and usability testing
  • Design systems for healthcare

Course Project

Teams of 3-4 students will design a complete digital health application from research through high-fidelity prototypes.

Grading

  • Individual Assignments: 30%
  • Team Project: 50%
  • Peer Reviews: 10%
  • Participation: 10%

pages.name: UX Research Methods
pages.content:
User Research in Healthcare

Qualitative Methods

  • User Interviews: One-on-one conversations with patients, providers, and caregivers
  • Contextual Inquiry: Observing users in their natural environment
  • Diary Studies: Long-term insights into patient experiences

Quantitative Methods

  • Surveys: Large-scale data collection
  • Analytics: Usage patterns and behavior tracking
  • A/B Testing: Comparing design variations

Special Considerations for Healthcare

  • IRB approval for research with patients
  • HIPAA compliance in data collection
  • Sensitive topic handling
  • Diverse user populations (age, ability, health literacy)

sections.name: Week 2: Accessibility & Compliance
sections.summary: WCAG standards and HIPAA requirements for healthcare UX

pages.name: Accessibility Guidelines
pages.content:
Designing for Accessibility

WCAG 2.1 Level AA Requirements

  • Perceivable: Text alternatives, captions, adaptable content
  • Operable: Keyboard accessible, enough time, navigable
  • Understandable: Readable, predictable, input assistance
  • Robust: Compatible with assistive technologies

Healthcare-Specific Considerations

  • Large touch targets for users with tremors
  • High contrast for low vision
  • Plain language for health literacy
  • Screen reader support for blind users
  • Cognitive accessibility for elderly users

Testing Tools

  • WAVE (Web Accessibility Evaluation Tool)
  • axe DevTools
  • Screen readers (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver)
